Under directional boundedness, the conjugate of the (Real-valued) support function is the closed convex envelope of the indicator function.

Auxiliary definition: the EReal : TypeEReal-valued support function .

noncomputable def supportFunctionEReal {n : Nat} (C : Set (Fin n Real)) : (Fin n Real) EReal := fun xStar => sSup {z : EReal | x C, z = ((dotProduct x xStar : Real) : EReal)}

A 0 : 0/ : ?m.1-valued function with no : ?m.1 values is an indicator function of its 0 : 0-sublevel.

Theorem 13.2: The indicator function and the support function of a closed convex set are conjugate to each other. The functions which are the support functions of non-empty convex sets are the closed proper convex functions which are positively homogeneous.

Corollary 13.2.1. Let Unknown identifier `f`f be a positively homogeneous convex function which is not identically : ?m.1 (). theorem clConv_eq_supportFunctionEReal_setOf_forall_dotProduct_le {n : Nat} (f : (Fin n Real) EReal) (hpos : PositivelyHomogeneous f) (_hconv : ConvexFunction f) (hnotTop : ( x : Fin n Real, f x = )) EReal)) -- Rewrite the preimage as the comprehension defining `C`. have : IsClosed {xStar : Fin n Real | g xStar (0 : EReal)} := by simpa [Set.preimage, Set.mem_Iic] using hclosed_pre simpa [hCeq, g] using this have hCconv : Convex C := by have : Convex {xStar : Fin n Real | g xStar (0 : EReal)} := by simpa using (convexFunction_level_sets_convex (f := g) hg_conv (0 : EReal)).2 simpa [hCeq, g] using this -- Identify `g = f*` as an indicator function of `C`. have hzeroTop : xStar : Fin n Real, g xStar = 0 g xStar = := by intro xStar by_cases hxC : x : Fin n Real, ((dotProduct x xStar : Real) ((dotProduct x xStar : Real) : EReal) := lt_of_not_ge hx simpa [g] using section13_fenchelConjugate_eq_top_of_exists_dotProduct_gt (n := n) (f := f) hpos xStar x, hxlt have hg_indicator : g = indicatorFunction C := by -- `g` is a `0/`-valued function, hence an indicator of its `0`-sublevel. have hg0 : g = indicatorFunction {xStar : Fin n Real | g xStar (0 : EReal)} :=
